intro: Bulbostylis pohliana, commonly known as the Pohliana bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a small, herbaceous grass that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown and are adapted for wind pollination. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in swampy or marshy environments.
